critique: This document amends a previous executive order (EO 10182) regarding the employment of individuals with outstanding experience and ability under the Defense Production Act of 1950. It clarifies compensation and appointment procedures for these individuals. There is no clear ideological tilt as it focuses on administrative matters. It doesn't directly address immigration, executive power in a significant way, federalism, national security vs. civil liberties, or social inclusion. It has a slight impact on economic regulation by allowing the employment of experts, potentially influencing economic policy, but the effect is minimal.
